title: Château Mongravey 2014  Margaux
description: Strong wood aging and toasty flavors dominate this wine. They give a hard extracted edge which takes away from the black-currant fruitiness. While this will soften, the fruit in this vintage should have been allowed more expression. Drink the wine from 2020.

title: Château Siaurac 2013 Baronne de Siaurac  (Lalande de Pomerol)
description: This is the second wine from Siaurac, generous and ripely fruity. It is packed with juicy blackberries, acidity and an open, generous character. With its fruit and soft tannins it needs no aging. Drink now.

title: Cheval Quancard 2014 Monfort Bellevue  (Médoc)
description: There are strong elements of the wood aging in this structured wine. That gives it a dry character that still dominates the red fruits. It needs to develop. While it will always have a dry character, look for the fruit to shine with its berry flavors and acidity. Wait to drink until 2018.

title: Clarendelle 2012  Bordeaux
description: This is a soft, fruity wine with comfortable tannins and bold black fruits. It is smoothly textured with just a hint of dryness. Now maturing well, this attractive wine should be ready from 2017.

title: Coteaux da Murta 2013 Quinta da Murta Arinto (Bucelas)
description: This mature wine, has lost youthful fruitiness and gained a more nutty, smooth and rich quality. There are touches of toastiness and almonds, with an aromatic aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Trapiche 2014 Broquel Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Loamy berry aromas smell a bit like wet clay and earth. This is fairly well structured, with grippy tannins. Baked, savory, oaky berry flavors finish with wood spice, clove and light herbal notes.

title: South Stage 2012 Grenache (Rogue Valley)
description: This powerful wine puts purple plum and tart cherry fruit front and center. That fruit drives the bus through a dense palate, with a burst of acidity adding a turbo charge. It saw 25% new French oak.

title: Yohan Lardy 2015 Les Michelons  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: The wine is still young with its crisp red fruits and tense tannins. It is a structured wine, firm with a dry core and still developing its fruitiness. It will need to age a while yet, so drink from 2018.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2014 Collection  (Saint-Amour)
description: From the northernmost of the Beaujolais cru villages, this is a ripe and full wine. With rich cherry flavors and just enough acidity, the wine is lightly structured with some dry tannins. It is ready to drink.

title: Proulx 2014 The Wah Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Candied black cherry and fresh boysenberry aromas meet with darker touches of soy, teriyaki and burnt caramel on the nose of this bottling. The palate is mineral-driven, with light tar, asphalt and peppercorn flavors leading into dusty elderberry fruit.

title: Podere ai Valloni 2014 Gratus Bio Red (Colline Novaresi)
description: A blend of 85% Nebbiolo and 15% Uva Rara, this fragrant red boasts alluring scents of pressed rose, moist earth, aromatic herb and whiff of exotic spice. The racy straightforward palate doles out tart red cherry, star anise and a hint of clove alongside fine-grained tannins and firm acidity.

title: Wirra Wirra 2015 Scrubby Rise White (Adelaide)
description: An innovative blend of Sauvignon Blanc (53%), Semillon (37%) and Viognier (10%), this medium-bodied wine delivers a mix of figs and melons, underscored by a silky texture. Ready to drink.

title: Zolo 2015 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Cola, plum and red-currant aromas set up a tight palate with clamping tannins. Flavors of black cherry, cassis, plum and chocolate are lasting across the finish. This needs hearty food, additional airing or both to show its best.
designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled

title: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2014 Merlot-Cabernet Franc (Washington)
description: Light in color, this wine offers high-toned aromas of herb, cherry, clove, wood spice and exotic spice. The palate is quite elegant in style, wanting a bit more heft to fully bring it together.

title: Analemma 2014 Oak Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: Pinot Noir is a relative rarity in Washington, this one coming from the highlands above the town of Husum. It brings aromas of earth, game, dried mushroom and strawberry that lead to plump elegantly styled fruit and savory flavors, with a finish that lingers.

title: Archium 2014 Faction Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Dried red fruit, a touch of tar, fresh violets and cola spice show on this bottling's nose, which is reserved in style. Dried strawberry and cranberry flavors unfold on the palate, along with hints of caramel and hibiscus, proving refreshing if not deep in style.

title: Balletto 2015 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: From a relatively cool site for the variety, this white shows an abundance of green olive and Meyer lemon. Moderate body and acidity allow for a touch of lemongrass spiciness and black licorice amid the textured mouthfeel and length.

title: Château Poitevin 2014  Médoc
description: This is a perfumed, juicy wine. It has attractive red-berry fruits and touches of black currant. Still young, the wine is still shot through with tannins and a firm structure. This will soften over the next year to give a fruity, smooth wine. Drink from 2018.

title: Chopo 2014 Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Jammy plum and berry aromas come with dessert herb scents. A juicy palate doesn't offer much structure, but this Monastrell-Syrah blend tastes good courtesy of plum, blackberry and toasty flavors. The ripe warm finish is generous.

title: Casto Oaks 2014 Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: This very focused wine is deeply colored, has smoky, meaty aromas and concentrated fruit flavors. It is full bodied, firm and moderately tannic in texture.

title: Château de Paillet-Quancard 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Grown on the slopes above the Garonne river, this is a crisp wine with attractive black-currant fruitiness. It has soft tannins that are well integrated into the fruitiness and acidity of the wine. The aftertaste is crisp and the wine is ready to drink.

title: Château Haut Beyzac 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: Bringing together the fruit of the vintage with some firm structure, this is going to be a ripe and balanced wine. It will also have plenty of juicy acidity and black currant fruits. Let this wine develop and don't drink before 2020.

title: Barnard Griffin 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The fruit is at the fore here, with aromas of blue fruit, wet stone and spice, along with a whiff of tire rubber. The palate has sweet fruit flavors with nubby tannins and a tart coffee-filled finish.

title: Barrel Road 2014 Artisan Blend Red (California)
description: This light- to medium-bodied red wine doesn't take itself too seriously and will be versatile with food. The fruity, almost jammy and fresh aromas lead to dry, substantive flavors and a tempting, smooth texture.

title: Beacon Hill 2014 La Collina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Soft and accessible, this pushes pretty cherry fruit forward with pleasant notes of toast and mocha. Fermented with native yeast, it has an extra dollop of texture and detail.

title: Beckmen 2014 Cuvée Le Bec Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is a great everyday wine, with well-integrated aromas of pressed boysenberry, dried black cherry, black pepper and a touch of asphalt. Blueberry, beef crust, soy and pepper converge on the palate. The wine is smooth enough to work with a variety of dishes but packed with enough action to serve alone as well.

title: Brecon Estate 2014 Estate Tannat (Adelaida District)
description: The aromas are wound tightly on this bottling that eventually shows asphalt, lava rock, violet and a touch of blueberry on the nose. There's a strong dose of acidity on the front of the sip, leading into boysenberry, elderberry, pepper and herb flavors.

title: Brian Carter Cellars 2013 One Olsen Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas of cocoa and dark raspberry are speckled with light barrel accents. The red-fruit flavors are ripe and generous, dipping in the middle before coming back together on the elegant finish.

title: Cadaretta 2015 SBS Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Sauvignon Blanc makes up a full 89% of this blend. It offers light aromas of melon, grass, tropical fruit and citrus that are followed by tart zingy flavors, with the concentration seeming a bit light.

title: Cadus 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Agrelo)
description: Aromas of prune, blackberry, lemon peel and shoe polish are dark and earthy. This feels full and chewy, with hard tannins. Dark toasty black-fruit flavors come with herbal notes and wood spice flavors, while this tastes herbal, oaky, minty and like clove on the finish.
